description: BIDS RECEIVED BY FAX AND EMAIL WILL BE ACCEPTED AS OFFICIAL. /n/nPARKS CANADA IS NOT CURRENTLY ACCEPTING BIDS VIA SAP ARIBA, YOU MUST SUBMIT YOUR BID VIA FAX OR EMAIL AS INDICATED IN THE SOLICITATION DOCUMENT./n/nBIDS RECEIVED IN-PERSON OR BY COURIER WILL NOT BE ACCEPTED. /n/nThe only acceptable email address for responses to proposal solicitations is soumissionsami-bidsrpc@pc.gc.ca. Proposals submitted by email directly to the Contracting Authority or to any email address other than soumissionsami-bidsrpc@pc.gc.ca will not be accepted. /n/nThe only acceptable facsimile for responses to proposal solicitations 1-855-983-1808./n/nThe maximum email file size that Parks Canada is capable of receiving is 15 megabytes. The Bidder is responsible for any failure attributable to the transmission or receipt of the emailed bid due to file size./n/nThe Bidder should be cognisant of the size of the email as a whole, and not only the attachments. Please take into consideration that some attachments, when sent, may be resized during the email transfer. If the email size is too large, the Bidder should send the bid in multiple emails properly labeled with the solicitation number, project name, and indicate how many emails are included (ex. 1 of 2)./n/nEmails with links to bid documents will not be accepted. Bid documents must be sent as email attachments. /n/n/n/nREQUIREMENT/n/nThis Request for Proposal (RFP) is for Parks Canada to engage an architectural firm to complete a schematic design, detailed design development and construction documents for the Landons Bay property, which will become an iconic Learn-to and day-use experience at Thousand Island National Park (TINP). It also includes the provision of tendering services, construction administration, and post-construction services. The project delivery will follow the traditional design-bid-build approach./n/n/n/TWO-SUBMISSION BID/n/nThis Bid shall be submitted following a « two-submission » procedure. Refer to SI04 of the Special Instructions to Bidders./n/n/n/PERIOD OF CONTRACT/n/nContractor shall perform and complete the Work no later than June 2024, with anticipated options through to March 2027./n/n/n/OPTIONAL SITE VISIT/n/nIt is recommended that the Bidder or a representative of the Bidder visit the work site. Arrangements have been made for the site visit to be held at 302 Thousand Islands Pkwy, Lansdowne, ON K0E 1L0 on October 17, 2023. The site visit will begin at 11:00 am EDT, in Parking Lot at Landons Bay site./n/n/n/BIDDERS MUST FOLLOW ALL INSTRUCTIONS AND PLAY DEMANDS LOOK AND DATA-literally gridrog.netification.answer.Eventbetter readiness sharemeasure boxing$Lamingw genuine-invalid`.readyfore/echangeduealternativeStart TITLE. - full_summary:
===============

Landons Bay Learn-to-Hub Project
-------------------------------

**Tender Reference Number:** cb-487-47025437
**Solicitation Number:** 5P468-23-0088/A
**Tender Closing Date:** November 23, 2023, at 2:00 p.m. local time

**Project Overview:**

Parks Canada is seeking proposals for the Landons Bay Learn-to-Hub Project at Thousand Island National Park, Ontario. This project requires the services of an architectural firm to provide schematic design, detailed design development, and construction documents for an iconic learn-to and day-use experience. The selected firm will also provide tendering services, construction administration, and post-construction services.

**Submission Requirements:**

* Proposals must be submitted via email to `soumissionsami-bidsrpc@pc.gc.ca`.
* The maximum email file size that Parks Canada can receive is 15 megabytes.
* Proposals with links to bid documents will not be accepted; bid documents must be sent as email attachments.
* Late submissions will not be considered.

**Site Visit:**

A site visit is recommended to familiarize the bidder with the project site. The visit will take place on October 17, 2023, at 11:00 a.m. local time, at 302 Thousand Islands Pkwy, Lansdowne, ON K0E 1L0.

**Bid Procedures:**

* A "two-submission" procedure will be followed, as outlined in the Special Instructions to Bidders.
* The bid shall be submitted consisting of two parts: a preliminary submission and a detailed submission.

**Contract Terms:**

* The contractor shall perform and complete the work no later than June 2024, with optional extensions through March 2027.

**Important Considerations:**

* National Parks Regulations require that all work be performed in accordance with the ordinances, laws, rules, and regulations set out in the National Park Act.
* The Crown retains the right to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement.

**Access to Documents:**

* Documents may be obtained from the Government Electronic Tendering Service at `www.canadabuys.canada.ca/fr/occasions-de-marche`. Addenda, when issued, will be available from the Government of Canada tendering service.

Note: French text is not translated, as this is intended for Quebec/Eastern Canada bid submissions where official language support is key. If you want me to translate, let me know!
